instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.C1950: What is C1950? Capacitor between PP3V42_G3H & ground on pin 8 of U1950 on 2013-2015 Macbook Pros & Airs that often corrodes. When corroded, pin 8 on U1950 will be damaged, which will prevent machine from booting and cause PM_SLP_S4_L to pulse. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
threads.message: Good day, I am a newb.  liquid damaged board, CPU not getting warm.  while reading forums for some help I looked at this section of the board to check for corrosion around <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.  I noticed these resistors are gone.  <RESISTOR>R5116</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5101</RESISTOR>.  I believe this would explain why I cannot reset SMC but do not know.  I looked at schems and do not believe that the lack of these resistors would cause no chime. no boot.  I am looking for advice on best way to check for missing voltage to allow MBA to post.  Any advice appreciated, please.  <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is present 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
threads.message:
Those 2 location are not stuffed. The machine turns on so <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> is working fine.

Is CPU Vcore present on L7310? <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> corroded?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
threads.message: on L7310 I get 1.698V.  <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> does not look corroded.  <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R1960</RESISTOR> when checking crumbled to dust.  next up will try and find a donor board with similar components.  At the risk of sounding stupid, do they need to be exact replacements?  what is the most efficient way to find these parts on other Macs?  Have plenty of dead ones here...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
threads.message: I am curious, it appears that many of the Main Logics have the same power circuitry.  Is there a defined efficient way to check in order power rails quickly to determine what exactly is missing?  On <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> on this board after looking at the logic breakdown of the chip and then looking at schematics I noticed many of the power rails were the same throughout the board.  Is there a voltage divider that takes the AC in and splits all these power rails? There has to be some power regulation/creator circuitry that pumps out all needed voltages...  Sadly, Because I am a newb and learning slowly I cannot find this in the schems...  is there test point locations on the board that breaks out these voltages?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
threads.message: If CPU Vcore is present all other rail will be OK. Is a USB mouse lighting up then plugged in? Does the board turn on/off 3 times before staying on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
threads.message:
Yes, Mouse does light on both USB ports.  Board stays on, does not turn on/off 3x.


 looking forward to review of worthy hot air station,  tried to purchase Crest cleaner however site states still out of stock.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
threads.message: Do a PRAM reset with and external keyboard. If a USB mouse lights up it means the board is working somewhat. After PRAM reset it should chime, IO board needs to be connected of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
threads.message: installed board into chassis, connected speakers.  with AC adapter plugged in fan spins automatically normal speed, when I do connect the AC adapter the fan automatically spins without hitting power key.  With Apple external keyboard and Apple mouse connected on both left and right side no mouse light.  Mouse lights if only it is connected to both sides.  Could not complete PRAM reset.  To me it seems like it is getting some power, just not enough.  I have not replaced <CAPACITOR>C1950</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R1960</RESISTOR>.  What should be correct voltages on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.?  What is good voltage for CPU Vcore?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
threads.message: CPU Vcore would be 1.7V or so.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
threads.message: Purchased the newer Crest today off your site.  Waiting patiently to find out what Hot air station is preferred.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no post chime, good USB, no boot, no video, fan speed good
threads.message: Just check voltage on <RESISTOR>R1962</RESISTOR>, if that is 3V then <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> should be fine.
